column1: Lou Malnati's Pizzeria////This place is BEAUTIFUL. I love how industrial
column2: yet inviting it is. The name caught my eye
column3: but the inside was just so cute and authentic. A very family- oriented
column4: yet fun restaurant. The downstairs was bustling with people
column5: but the upstairs was better suited for larger parties. The restaurant looks like you're in an Italian home. The service was amazing and the food was great too. Very fresh and yummy. I even asked for plain pasta that wasn't on the menu (I'm picky) and the waiter accommodated me. Would go again!
